body:
I've reverted changes related to "Fix Imports" once, then I've fixed some issues without complicated changes again.
So, I hope that this regression is resolved in NB19.

Please give it a try when NB19-rc is released if possible.
Please give attention to notes like this one, I think this bug has to change priority as it is so frequent that is killing everyday usage experience.

> Locating this in the "New project" dialog is odd and the last place I would look for modifying an existing project.
> 
> If we want to get this in fast and now, then I suggest to make this an entry in the "Tools" menu. From a UX perspective though, I would prefer integration through the hint interface, as this nicely aligns with general cleanup and platform updates.

@matthiasblaesing Honestly, tools menu isn't much better IMO - its also not a place where I look for refactoring tasks. The implementation right now is separate from everything and not intrusive, I would be ok with integrating it as experimental feature, it seems like there is interest to properly integrate it at some point in future. (But my initial reaction was similar to yours)

The module has no public API (I removed that export), so we could remove it in future again if there is no interest to improve it. It could be extracted to a plugin (plugin portal) for example in that case.

This could be even delivered as maven hint, since it could directly annotate the dependency in the pom, replace it, then run the transformation.

We could of course also move this to NB 20, but the feature does work - maybe someone will find it useful in its early stage.

@qmegas 
Please use the code completion for `include` and `require`. (e.g. `inclu` + <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Space</kbd>) That way, `;` is added automatically. "`i` + `n` + `c` + `l` + `u` + `d` + `e` + ` ` + `'` " is inconvenient, I think.

The ProblemReporterImpl commit alone is suffcient to fix #6176. 

I am a little nervous about the SimpleLocalRepository > EnhancedLocalRepository change as it might affect different operations in Maven; but unless this is used, the `MavenEmbedder.resolve()` will be satisifed with the locally existing artifact (although never downloaded from an unreachable repo) and will not report errors.

If some problems arise, this 2nd commit could be safely reverted - resulting in 2nd cycle in ProblemReporterImpl.

I'm agree with you guys that this tool can be improved, as @mbien  said probably we can accept, merge and go with this as an experimental feature, then I will work to improve it for the next release. What do you think?

the second commit appears to be the cause of the test failures.

I ran a quick local test and they appear to pass using only the first commit.
Squashed the commits optimistically assuming no further changes will be requested, but I can still make updates if necessary.
Tested with the original problematic maven project and the constructed testcase from the issue and seems to work as it should. Thank you.
I'll take care of the tests tomorrow / till Monday. Either adapt code (tests) to the suddenly-working artifact resolution, or discard the embedder change.
I had the same problem, unchecking 'Print Maven output logging level' in menu Tools - Options - Java - Maven solved it for me.
adding all-tests label since who knows what else uses the embedder/model indirectly

Software: Netbeans IDE 16
JDK: 1.8 x64
Specs: 
- Intel i5-10th gen
- 16GB RAM
(spec is ok)

I also have this problem and NO ONE, NO ONE is able to solve this problem on my laptop (it happens only on my laptop). EVEN MY LECTURER don't know how to handle this problem. This is very annoying.

I've tried to:
1. Re-install netbeans 16
2. Search for solutions on google & youtube (nothing works 'til now)
3. Delete netbeans shortcut on my desktop (btw is this what u guys mean by broken links? doesn't work for me)

Can someone pls help, I have to wait for 2 minutes just to navigate projects T_T

> Thanks for it. Unfortunately, I can't reproduce it.

Sometimes bugs happen, not every time. When a failure occurs, the only solution is to close the file and reopen it.

> @rfrkk Is this `Projects` or `File` view?

You can create empty php project, and copy these files into project.
Best guess: Should link/redirect to: https://netbeans.apache.org/blogs/geertjan/index.html
@matthiasblaesing awesome! Applied the changes. All tests are working again in that module!

`testHiddenUse: org.netbeans.modules.java.openjdk.jtreg.ModulesHintTest`
`testMultiplePackages: org.netbeans.modules.java.openjdk.jtreg.ModulesHintTest`
 failed three times in a row Will likely turn that test off.
 
 The test is also throwing several exceptions even when passing.
 

edit: this might be the reason the tests were commented out on travis in an attempt to stabilize CI
starting another run with all tests enabled to check for side effects. Planning to merge this on Sunday.
panning to merge this too on Sunday before freeze. Is a fairly low risk fix.
Here's the PR to update the current achetype: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6201
recommend to merge after #6160 which hooks `maven.j2ee` tests into CI
going to resolve merge conflict in `project.xml` locally, force push and merge once green again
all green and its technically Sunday -> merging

I have a squashed and rebased version of this PR here: https://github.com/mbien/netbeans/tree/FISH-6771-support-transformation-jakartaee8-to-jakartaee10

(I removed the FISH-6771 from the msg since I believe that this is an internal issue tracker)

If everyone is ok with this I can force push into this PR and merge on Sunday evening. (we don't use gh ui for squashing since it caused issues before with noreply mails in author headers etc)
I'd be happy to see this in NetBeans 19 and improved in a future release, as needed.  Nice work!  This will be very nice indeed for helping to further Jakarta EE 10 adoption.
@asbachb small merge conflict to resolve if you have time (without github ui please)

Could reproduce this on NetBean 18, OpenJDK17, Maven Project:

Create Maven Project, Tools -> Create / Update Tests, `assertTrue(false);`, Right Click Test class -> Test File

Rerun failed button cannot be clicked.

please let me know when and how to test this promising release
Louis
@junichi11 At the end it's not a big deal for me to write whole operator `include "";` even without auto-completion, but that is just a workaround.
Same behavior on master (02dafb29b878e45d66be1e1dc95f018f8e71cf87)

I would call for more review and approval once this PR would be ready. I've raised this as a preview to get help from @mbien resolbing my Java 11 vs UnitTest issues.

I would have liked this included in NetBeans 19. Though it is not ready yet, there are lot of crufts to be removed/polished, also this alone does not add any functionality to the IDE at the moment, Though many advanced IDE things requires to be able to have the complete AST available..

So the Options panel for Rust looks like this now:

Thinking of it, maybe we want to have separate "Cargo" and "Rustup" tabs, instead of a common "Paths" tab?
@breakponchito congrats to your first contribution and thanks for your patience -> merging

I was having similar annoying problems on net beans 18 - so I cloned (with git) and built (with maven) from master and now my IDE is running (fairly smoothly)

Is there anyway you could try to do that too?

@aagguuss You need to provide more information. For me it's totally unclear what "creating a class using JPA" means and what "stopp being able to use it" should mean.
I'd encourage you to provide some step by step guidance how to reproduce the problem, an error message or screenshots so that anybody can have a better understanding what's going on.
Unfortunately this does not solve the issue for me.
@sdedic are we closing this?
Hi, I would say I agree, maybe opening github issue on netbeans-website may help.

That would be a solution.
But issues are not enabled on that GH repo.
Also there needs to be links to the website issue URL, so reporters know where to go.

@sebbASF perhaps open discussion on dev@.  As @ebarboni says, enabling issues on the website repo might be the way forward.  But we might also want to consider forms, labels, etc. and the right way to manage to stop it becoming a black hole.
I'm gonna buy you some coffees for that @asbachb, many thanks!
Should be fixed within: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6201
For me, adding `-J-DTopSecurityManager.disable=true` to netbeans.conf does not help.

> For me, adding `-J-DTopSecurityManager.disable=true` to netbeans.conf does not help.

Strange. That would mean you either put this on the wrong place or NbClipboard is not the cause of the problem. So Javas system clipboard handling would be the problem. 
To be honest I tested it with a platform application. Maybe within Netbeans IDE itself there is more. And I used the command line and not netbeans.conf. Where did you put it there?

@istinnstudio have added the high priority label, although it doesn't change a lot until we have a consistent way to reproduce.  It is considered high priority anyway, but it's not going to get a milestone until someone who can fix it can also reproduce it.

@wumpz IIRC that is not the only thing required to disable it being used in some key places.

> Where did you put it there?

Appended `-J-DTopSecurityManager.disable=true` to "netbeans_default_options" key in netbeans.conf.

At the same time I excluded two keys `-J-Dnetbeans.slow.system.clipboard.hack=false -J-Dorg.netbeans.NbClipboard.level=FINEST` and experience perceptible frequency increase of clipboard errors without those two keys and in presence of the `-J-DTopSecurityManager.disable=true` key.
thanks everyone, merging in an hour or two so that it doesn't miss the deadline.

@jlahoda @lahodaj if you want to use both accounts, we probably have to figure something out. Should we add collaborator access for your second account? What account should we use to ping you? You can also mail me directly if you want. 
cc @neilcsmith-net
going to squash and force push into this PR later unless someone is faster, since the deadline is today night UTC - would be a shame to miss out on it.

I've been mostly out of the NetBeans loop over the last couple of weeks freeing time up for the release.  Shame this has missed further review.

I share some of @errael concerns on the API additions, but think it would be good to get the fix in 19.  It'll miss merging before freeze, but can probably target 19-rc2.

can we merge this and fix the remaining issue during RC1?

my understanding is:
 - this PR causes no known regression
 - it improves the current situation
 - the remaining problem is likely fixable without having to rewrite everything
 
 deadline is today night UTC
I fixed the mentioned use case, currently in testing phase.
I think we need to require the account that is linked to ASF for a variety of reasons.

Pushed fixed for that use case. Tested with steps mentioned in https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/6129#pullrequestreview-1531768724

* Jakarta EE 10 application
* Jakarta EE 8 application

> @istinnstudio have added the high priority label, although it doesn't change a lot until we have a consistent way to reproduce. It is considered high priority anyway, but it's not going to get a milestone until someone who can fix it can also reproduce it.
> 
> @wumpz IIRC that is not the only thing required to disable it being used in some key places.

You are right. This is only my small personal effort to get closer to the root of this clipboard hell. However, switching off this security manager simply switches for normal Swing components to standard clipboard behaviour. So isn't that a sign that the problem is indeed in NbClipboard?


@epliskin So sorry, that it doesn't help. I simply try to give this issue some more input, while not being a collaborator for this project myself.

Thanks @junichi11 

I've tried to reproduce the issue with the largest open source PHP based project I know (Magento) but I wasn't able to reach similar results. I was able to partially mitigate the issue in NB18 by adding most of the `vendor` folder to Ignored directories, to the point that "Fix Imports" is usable again.

I'll post an update when NB19 is out, however I fear that the main cause of the issue is the operating system and its notoriously slow (or so they say) file system, multiplied by the project size and amount of data to parse and changes to "Fix Imports" only helped to manifest that more. Perhaps there is a space for some optimizations in that field, but it seems like a lot of work and definitely outside of the scope of this issue.
@mbien @jGauravGupta @OndroMih @matthiasblaesing thank you guys for your help an patience

For me the only way to reset the clipboard madness is to copy a class from the projects tab. Then copy  from e.g. a browser and paste to editor will work again, until a new series of internal editor copy/paste sessions will occur (or something else).  Then the issue reappears and a new reset is needed. I cannot say this behavior can be replicated, but someone facing the issue could test and confirm this, it might be a starting point alongside with [wumpz](https://github.com/wumpz) notes.
What's the status of this PR?  It's bumped through two milestones now - should either review / fix / merge, or close.
well. this little loop quickly became more complicated than anticipated.

-0 from me, sorry.  I'm not sure hard-coding a link to a feed we don't control is a good idea.  The summary as is doesn't look great (although might get us to write better release notes!).  We should think about whether advertising unreleased rc's here is a good idea.  And it doesn't address the issue of all the extant other releases of the IDE that won't get this fixed.

Personally, I'd stick with what we do control, request infra help in redirecting the existing links to static files, including a (for now) static feed file.  Almost the only thing that's gone in for a while is new releases, so not too much work to keep up-to-date pending replacing this with something else.
ok with me, I am not going to do the infra part though. Only had time for this hotfix.
@mbien thanks for stepping in. PRs are green. I checked, that the squash did not change the modfied file. Lets merge.
Afaik there is also red for warnings which seems incorrect for me. Or maybe it was ant. But afaik red should be errornous stuff and maybe yellow warnings, etc.
Oh and of course @SirIntellegence thank you for caring enough to fix the issue ;-)
Thanks for the update, I'm doing a local sanity build and if  ok, I'll merge.

> Personally, I'd stick with what we do control,

I do get what you mean, but we do control the content of the feed. Only committer can add feed entries by creating releases.

Yes, but we don't have control of how that content is used to generate the feed, or whether it will continue to exist.

I'll ping infra to see what's possible.  The main link is fine, except it redirects to a page that doesn't currently exist, just need to redirect https://blogs.apache.org/netbeans/feed/entries/atom to something I guess?
@neilcsmith-net  eric is on it already: https://github.com/apache/netbeans-website/pull/659

The workaround is given in the Jansi issue you linked, and also the trade off that introduces (eg. other aspects of output parsing no longer work).

Moving this to a feature request.

I am not planning to implement this, adding https://github.com/apache/netbeans/labels/Contribution%20welcome label.

the feature is already there it just can't be permanently enabled to sync Favourites automatically.

try hitting `ctrl+shift+3`
1 is Projects tab, 2 Files, 3 Favorites

I use it fairly often since I have sync disabled. I typically also have not the same folder expanded in the three views.
Ah, right. Sorry. I got to squish XD. Thanks.

I wonder if it would be useful to have an alternative to the current output panel. For `mvnd` the output is not optimal as well. When you launch it from the embedded terminal it looks quite good but lacks features like folding (which I actually never used).
Maybe we could introduce an option to execute maven on the terminal?
This was fixed with #6160
Then we can also have an alternative output panel for git, ant, npm, etc... so I would like to let them as it is, because we already have more than just maven.

It will be more obvious for users

@mbien what do you mean ? whats the reason it can't be?

@neilcsmith-net what do you mean not sûre to understand

@albilu eg. I have the netbeans source root as a favourite.  Any file in netbeans will be found under the home dir tree and the netbeans tree. Using `ctrl+shift+3` seems to pick the "right" one anyway.
Planning to branch in a couple of hours - if this belongs in 19 please merge.

> what do you mean ? whats the reason it can't be?

@albilu I just mean that there is no auto sync for the fav tab implemented, but the feature is essentially already present as hotkey action. So the missing piece is auto-sync, since sync functionality is there.

the folding is just a UI gimmick. The reason it is there is because NB has to compute the context for links in many situations. If you doing that already you may as well add the folding which is a low hanging fruit once you parse the output.

mvnd integration is fairly rudimentary. Partially because the project itself hasn't stabilized yet. I can't use it in many projects still since it often causes other issues.
@lahodaj please use the GitHub account tied to your ASF membership. Commit email should ideally be tied to that too.

@rkeen-siemens @errael I wouldn't normally do this way, but have addressed some of the comments here in another PR #6216 . I want to get in before branching for NB19 so we can get in the first release candidate in case of problems.  Please double-check that and if necessary we can make further changes in delivery before rc2. Thanks!
1-2 risky merges per release are ok - otherwise the RC phase would be too boring :)
OK, missed the cut. Please rebase on delivery if there's an argument for getting into 19.

before merge, please don't forget to bump the version at

I think I found the issue. Let me take a look.

I would also like to note that the issue occurs on both directions, a copy from editor and a paste to external app does not work sometimes either, the same reset described above fixes the issue for a while. So the issue can happen on both directions copy from editor to external app and from external app to editor.

Recap of this PR:
1) On Windows, if the user moves the NetBeans install directory, NetBeans will fail to start, because the cache directory contains some absolute paths to files in the NetBeans install directory. The latter is itself a bug, because the cache directory is not supposed to contain absolute paths (we know this since @jtulach once wrote a testCachesDontUseAbsolutePaths test).
2) The fix to the underlying bug in (1) would be to eliminate the absolute paths, but I looked into that and couldn't figure out how.
3) This PR takes a different approach: Just make sure the cache directory gets invalidated whenever the installation path changes. I think that's a good idea in any case; moving the install directory is a rare occurrence, except maybe if running from a USB drive where drive letters change or such.
4) As it happens, this PR itself fails the testCachesDontUseAbsolutePaths test because the invalidation is done by adding the absolute install path to the all-checksum.txt file. But I can just make it pass by allowing that particular occurrence of the absolute path, in all-checksum.txt only.

Unless @jtulach disagrees, my inclination here would be to fix the failing test by adjusting testCachesDontUseAbsolutePaths  to allow the absolute path in all-checksum.txt .

The main possible objection here would be in giving up the "feature" of being able to move the NetBeans install directory without invalidating the cache directory. (I think that's acceptable, in return for eliminating a whole class of bugs that make NetBeans permanently un-startable.)
